comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; X11; FreeBSD i386; en) Opera 8.54
Build Identifier: Mozilla Firefox 1.5.0.2, Copyright (c) 1998 - 2006 mozilla.org 

hi install Firefox from the ports Under Freebsd ; when i run it  ; he print an long list (see the url please )

but what is interesting in point of vue is the output of

Free# firefox --help
Usage: /usr/X11R6/lib/firefox/firefox-bin [ options ... ] [URL]
       where options include:

X11 options
        --display=DISPLAY               X display to use
        --sync          Make X calls synchronous
        --no-xshm               Don't use X shared memory extension
        --xim-preedit=STYLE
        --xim-status=STYLE
        --g-fatal-warnings              Make all warnings fatal

Mozilla options
        -height <value>         Set height of startup window to <value>.
        -h or -help             Print this message.
        -width <value>          Set width of startup window to <value>.
        -v or -version          Print Firefox version.
        -P <profile>            Start with <profile>.
        -ProfileManager         Start with profile manager.
        -UILocale <locale>              Start with <locale> resources as UI Locale.
        -contentLocale <locale>         Start with <locale> resources as content Locale.
Type Manifest File: /usr/X11R6/lib/firefox/components/xpti.dat
*** Registering Apprunner components (all right -- a generic module!)
nsNativeComponentLoader: autoregistering begins.
nsNativeComponentLoader: autoregistering succeeded
nsNativeComponentLoader: registering deferred (0)
  -jsconsole           Open the JavaScript console.
  -browser            Open a browser window.
  -inspect <url>       Open the URL in the DOM inspector.
  -inspector           Open the DOM inspector.
Usage: firefox [-flags] [<url>]
WARNING: nsExceptionService ignoring thread destruction after shutdown, file nsException
Service.cpp, line 191
nsStringStats
 => mAllocCount:           1239
 => mReallocCount:          845
 => mFreeCount:            1239
 => mShareCount:           1504
 => mAdoptCount:            161
 => mAdoptFreeCount:        160  --  LEAKED 1 !!!


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.cd /usr/ports/www/firefox
2.make install clean
3.firefox

Actual Results:  
firefox is beeping and printing messages errors every time i try to access to a web page true ; but it work
comments.creator: b_52globemaster@yahoo.fr

comments.raw_text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.0.7) Gecko/20060911 SUSE/1.5.0.7-1.2 Firefox/1.5.0.7

Just loaded the latest SUSE updates and Firefox was among them.  Now, it is constantly beeping at me.  It is extremely annoying, so much so that I may try other browsers.

It may be related to cookies.  I use "ln -s /dev/null cookies.txt".
comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.0.7) Gecko/20060911 SUSE/1.5.0.7-1.2 Firefox/1.5.0.7

Just loaded the latest SUSE updates and Firefox was among them.  Now, it is constantly beeping at me.  It is extremely annoying, so much so that I may try other browsers.

It may be related to cookies.  I use "ln -s /dev/null cookies.txt".

comments.creator: steve.england@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Reporter, do you still see this problem with the latest Firefox 2? If not, can you please close this bug as WORKSFORME. Thanks!
comments.author: steve.england@gmail.com
comments.text: Reporter, do you still see this problem with the latest Firefox 2? If not, can you please close this bug as WORKSFORME. Thanks!

(In reply to comment #0)
> firefox is beeping and printing messages errors every time i try to access to a
> web page true ; but it work

You have built a debug version of Firefox.  Try editing your .mozconfig file
and then rebuild.
http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Configuring_Build_Options

-> INVALID
